intro: Diporidium boivinianum, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and yellowish flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that contain several seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded forest environments. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and medicinal contexts.
